t: O*pn Israel, return to the Lord*s your God, For*ld you have stumbled because of your iniquity;
Take*ld words with you, And*ld return to the Lord.*s Say*ld to Him, “Take*ld away all iniquity; Receive*ld us*i graciously, For*ld we will offer the sacrifices of our lips.
Assyria*ld shall not save us, We*ld will not ride on horses, Nor*ld will we say anymore to the work of our hands, ‘You*i are*i our gods.’ For*ld in You the fatherless finds mercy.”
“I*ln will heal their backsliding, I*ld will love them freely, For*ld My anger has turned away from him.
I*ld will be like the dew to Israel; He*ld shall grow like the lily, And*ld lengthen his roots like Lebanon.
His*ld branches shall spread; His*ld beauty shall be like an olive tree, And*ld his fragrance like Lebanon.
Those*ld who dwell under his shadow shall return; They*ld shall be revived like*i grain, And*ld grow like a vine. Their*ld scent shall*i be*i like the wine of Lebanon.
“Ephraim*ln shall*i say,*i ‘What have I to do anymore with idols?’ I*ld have heard and observed him. I*ld am*i like a green cypress tree; Your*ld fruit is found in Me.”

Who*ln is*i wise? Let*ld him understand these things. Who*ild is*i prudent? Let*ld him know them. For*ld the ways of the Lord*s are*i right; The*ld righteous walk in them, But*ld transgressors stumble in them.
